NoteLiteral.En:
Entry requirements:
•	Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
•	B2 level of English language proficiency.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).
Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.
Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.

Description.En:
Effective decision-making requires tools for evaluating choices. This module provides the basic tools for evaluating costs and benefits of decision-making through project financial and social-economic analysis. Almost every company and various governing bodies require a cost-benefit analysis to ensure that the right decisions are made with limited resources. Whether these decisions relate to investment projects or broader social policy, it is essential that these choices are evaluated to ensure an optimal outcome.

This module is designed to provide students with the analytical and critical thinking skills required to carry out a financial and social-economic project evaluation. By developing these skills, the student should be able to evaluate projects in the environment around us.

NoteLiteral.En: Learners will be able to use various evaluation methods .
Learners will be able to use methods to perform financial analysis of the project.
Learners will be able to use methods to perform socio-economic analysis of the project.
Learners will be able to conduct a sensitivity analysis and make decisions.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral: It is essential for every company and various governing bodies that projects’ choices would be evaluated to ensure an optimal outcome

What do we aim to achieve and learn: 
 * use of various quantitative evaluation methods in project evaluation process 
 * evaluate project financial effectiveness 
 * evaluate project social – economical benefit 
 * evaluate project risk 
 * conduct a sensitivity analysis

​​Entry requirements:

- Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).  

Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.  

Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.
